pkgmetadata.longdescription:
While most of the tools used in the Linux containers ecosystem are written in Go, crun authors believe C is a better fit for a lower level tool like a container runtime. runc; the most used implementation of the OCI runtime specs written in Go, re-execs itself and use a module written in C for setting up the environment before the container process starts.
crun aims to be also usable as a library that can be easily included in programs without requiring an external process for managing OCI containers.

use.flag: Enable in Kernel, eBPF (enhanced Berkley Packet Filter) support for managing device controllers.
